Package eu.df.jiffybox.internal

Class DefaultJiffyBoxBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonSerializable.Base
      • com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode
        • com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.node.BaseJsonNode

              • eu.df.jiffybox.internal.DefaultJiffyBoxBuilder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.fasterxml.jackson.core.TreeNode, com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonSerializable, com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.node.JsonNodeCreator, JiffyBoxBuilder, java.lang.Iterable<com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode>
    public class DefaultJiffyBoxBuilder
extends com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.node.ObjectNode
implements JiffyBoxBuilder
    This class is used to build JiffyBoxes. Use any of the methods you need and get the built object using the 'build' method.

    • Method Detail

      • fromDistribution

        public static JiffyBoxBuilder fromDistribution​(java.lang.String name,
                                               java.lang.String planId,
                                               java.lang.String distribution)
        Create a JiffyBox from scratch.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the JiffyBoxes to create. Up to 30 characters are allowed. Allowed characters are a-zA-Z0-9üöäÜÖÄß_()=!\*@.- and spaces. The JiffyBoxes name has to be unique.
        planId - The plan of a JiffyBox is either an unique number or the plans name (CloudLevel 1, CloudLevel 2 etc.). The IDs and other details of the plan can be obtained via the plans module.
        distribution - When provided, this is the distribution the new JiffyBox will have. A list of all distributions can be obtained via the distributions module. This parameter and backupid exclude each other but it is mandatory to provide one of them.
        Returns:
        The JiffyBoxBuilder.

      • fromDistribution

        public static JiffyBoxBuilder fromDistribution​(java.lang.String name,
                                               int planId,
                                               java.lang.String distribution)
        Create a JiffyBox from scratch.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the JiffyBoxes to create. Up to 30 characters are allowed. Allowed characters are a-zA-Z0-9üöäÜÖÄß_()=!\*@.- and spaces. The JiffyBoxes name has to be unique.
        planId - The plan of a JiffyBox is either an unique number or the plans name (CloudLevel 1, CloudLevel 2 etc.). The IDs and other details of the plan can be obtained via the plans module.
        distribution - When provided, this is the distribution the new JiffyBox will have. A list of all distributions can be obtained via the distributions module. This parameter and backupid exclude each other but it is mandatory to provide one of them.
        Returns:
        The JiffyBoxBuilder.

      • fromBackup

        public static JiffyBoxBuilder fromBackup​(java.lang.String name,
                                         java.lang.String planId,
                                         java.lang.String backupid)
        Create a JiffyBox from a backup.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the JiffyBoxes to create. Up to 30 characters are allowed. Allowed characters are a-zA-Z0-9üöäÜÖÄß_()=!\*@.- and spaces. The JiffyBoxes name has to be unique.
        planId - The plan of a JiffyBox is either an unique number or the plans name (CloudLevel 1, CloudLevel 2 etc.). The IDs and other details of the plan can be obtained via the plans module.
        backupid - When provided, this is the backup ID of the backup from which the JiffyBox should be created. A list of all backup IDs can be obtained via the backups module. This parameter and distribution exclude each other but it is mandatory to provide one of them.
        Returns:
        The JiffyBoxBuilder.

      • fromBackup

        public static JiffyBoxBuilder fromBackup​(java.lang.String name,
                                         int planId,
                                         java.lang.String backupid)
        Create a JiffyBox from a backup.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the JiffyBoxes to create. Up to 30 characters are allowed. Allowed characters are a-zA-Z0-9üöäÜÖÄß_()=!\*@.- and spaces. The JiffyBoxes name has to be unique.
        planId - The plan of a JiffyBox is either an unique number or the plans name (CloudLevel 1, CloudLevel 2 etc.). The IDs and other details of the plan can be obtained via the plans module.
        backupid - When provided, this is the backup ID of the backup from which the JiffyBox should be created. A list of all backup IDs can be obtained via the backups module. This parameter and distribution exclude each other but it is mandatory to provide one of them.
        Returns:
        The JiffyBoxBuilder.

      • withPassword

        public JiffyBoxBuilder withPassword​(java.lang.String password)
        Description copied from interface: JiffyBoxBuilder
        Set the password.
        Specified by:
        withPassword in interface JiffyBoxBuilder
        Parameters:
        password - When the password should not be generated randomly is can be set using this parameter. If this parameter is not provided the password will be generated randomly and sent via e-mail.
        Returns:
        The same builder for method chaining.

      • useSshKey

        public JiffyBoxBuilder useSshKey​(boolean useSshKey)
        Description copied from interface: JiffyBoxBuilder
        Set whether to use a ssh key.
        Specified by:
        useSshKey in interface JiffyBoxBuilder
        Parameters:
        useSshKey - When this parameter is provided and there is a SSH key saved within the control panel, this key will be granted root access to the newly created JiffyBox.
        Returns:
        The same builder for method chaining.

      • withMetadata

        public JiffyBoxBuilder withMetadata​(com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.node.ObjectNode metadata)
        Description copied from interface: JiffyBoxBuilder
        Set the metadata.
        Specified by:
        withMetadata in interface JiffyBoxBuilder
        Parameters:
        metadata - Each JiffyBox can contain optional data, which is returned on each request. This data is saved as hash for maximum flexibility. The value can be a complex type and will be returned just as it has been provided. The whole data may not exceed 4kb in size. Please notice, that this size refers to the generated JsonObject.
        Returns:
        The same builder for method chaining.
